communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: FTC FOIA Request Log for 2021, 2022, 2023 and 2024
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

A copy of the log of all Freedom of Information Act requests made with the Federal Trade Commission for calendar years 2021, 2022, 2023 and 2024. I ask that all fields — including the date, requester, description and disposition — are included.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Ben Welsh

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Untitled (Fontana Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Public records show that this agency has purchased Jacob Technology's 4G Condor (CSS) & 5G NR Base Station NG (CSS).  I am looking for:
- logs of all deployments of agency CSS or disaggregated dat showing the number of times the agency has used Jacob Technology's CSS tools or any similar CSS since 2020. 
- User manuals pertaining to CSS - this can be for the  4G Condor (CSS) or 5G NR Base Station NG (CSS) or any similar equipment
- Emails to and from eigtechsupport@jacobs.com please include attachments since 01/01/2020
- Emails from the department to any Jacob Technology Representative.  Please search for all emails ending in @jacobs.com
- Any policies and procedures governing the use of CSS

, I request that the agency provide the above records in their native digital format, where applicable (such as a CSV, Excel, or other digital data format), and transferred to me electronically. If you deny this request in whole or in part, I request that you respond with the statutory exemption underlying the denial and the reasoning therein. If an asserted exemption applies to only a portion of a record, please delete or redact the portion to which the exemption applies and provide the remainder of the record.

Thank you

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Dhruv Mehrotra

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: Outside Legal Bills
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

Since January 1, 2023 through current:

1) Copies of all invoices from the Tristan & Cervantes;
2) Copies of records of payments by CPS/Chicago Board of Tristan & Cervantes. I want the actual bills as well as proof of payment by the district.
3) Any and all letters of engagement between CPS/Chicago Board of Education and Tristan & Cervantes, including any modifications or changes.

4) Copies of all invoices from the Del Galdo LLC;
5) Copies of records of payments by CPS/Chicago Board of Education to Del Galdo LLC. I want the actual bills as well as proof of payment by the district.
6) Any and all letters of engagement between CPS/Chicago Board of Education and Del Galdo LLC, including any modifications or changes.

7) Copies of all invoices from the Salvatore & Prescott PLLC;
8) Copies of records of payments by CPS/Chicago Board of Education to Salvatore & Prescott PLLC. I want the actual bills as well as proof of payment by the district.
9) Any and all letters of engagement between CPS/Chicago Board of Education and Salvatore & Prescott PLLC, including any modifications or changes.

Because this request is in the public interest for Illinois nonprofit The FOIA Bakery’s work to advocate for public education, please waive any fees in accordance with 5 ILCS § 140/6(c). Feel free to contact me with any questions, or if clarification is needed.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Miriam Bhimani

Chicago Public Schools (CPS) responds to all public records requests in accordance with the Illinois Freedom of Information Act (FOIA), 5 ILCS 140/1 et seq. 
Due to the volume and complexity of requests received in the normal course of business, CPS is extending the time for its initial response to your request by an additional 5 business days (to 10 business days total beginning on the first business day following receipt of the request) pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/3(e)(v) which allows for the examination and evaluation of the requested records by personnel to determine if they are exempt from disclosure under Section 7 of Illinois FOIA or should be revealed only with appropriate deletions. 
Upon the completion of a response, CPS will provide the first 50 pages to you at no charge.  If a response is more than 50 pages, a fee of 15¢ per page will be charged for each additional page. Copies of video recordings have a fee of $48. All applicable fees must be paid prior to the copying. CPS will inform you of any fees due if your paper response exceeds 50 pages. You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you’ll receive an email when your request has been completed. Thank you for using the CPS FOIA Center. 

Track the issue status and respond at: https://cps.mycusthelp.com/WEBAPP//_rs/RequestEdit.aspx?rid=16018

communications.subject: Non-Commercial FOIA Request :: N016018-082024
communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 
September 19, 2024 Miriam Bhimani 172122-53282740@requests.muckrock.com 
RE: Chicago Public Schools FOIA Request N016018-082024 
Dear Ms. Bhimani: This letter is in reply to your Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request seeking the following information: Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records: Since January 1, 2023 through current: 1) Copies of all invoices from the Tristan & Cervantes; 2) Copies of records of payments by CPS/Chicago Board of Tristan & Cervantes. I want the actual bills as well as proof of payment by the district. 3) Any and all letters of engagement between CPS/Chicago Board of Education and Tristan & Cervantes, including any modifications or changes. 4) Copies of all invoices from the Del Galdo LLC; 5) Copies of records of payments by CPS/Chicago Board of Education to Del Galdo LLC. I want the actual bills as well as proof of payment by the district. 6) Any and all letters of engagement between CPS/Chicago Board of Education and Del Galdo LLC, including any modifications or changes. 7) Copies of all invoices from the Salvatore & Prescott PLLC; 8) Copies of records of payments by CPS/Chicago Board of Education to Salvatore & Prescott PLLC. I want the actual bills as well as proof of payment by the district. 9) Any and all letters of engagement between CPS/Chicago Board of Education and Salvatore & Prescott PLLC, including any modifications or changes. RESPONSE : Documents responsive to your request are available to download via the CPS FOIA Center at www.cps.edu/FOIARequests . Please log in with your username and password to access the records. Please note that there are no records responsive to parts three (3) and six (6) of this request, as there are no new letters of engagement, nor modifications or changes to prior letters, within the timeframe specified in this request. Invoices have been redacted in accordance with section 7(1)(m) of the FOIA to remove information constituting privileged attorney-client work product. Section 7(1)(m) of the FOIA exempts from release “[c]ommunications between a public body and an attorney [] representing the public body that would not be subject to discovery in litigation, and materials prepared or compiled by or for a public body in anticipation of a criminal, civil, or administrative proceeding upon the request of an attorney advising the public body.” 5 ILCS 140/7(1)(m). Nonpublic entities’ Employer Identification Numbers have been redacted p ursuant to section 7(1)(b), which exempts from release “[p]rivate information, unless disclosure is required by another provision of this Act, a State or federal law or a court order.” 5 ILCS 140/7(1)(b). Redactions were made to prevent “unavoidably disclos[ing] the identity of a confidential source, confidential information furnished only by the confidential source, or persons who file complaints with or provide information to administrative, investigative, law enforcement, or penal agencies.” 5 ILCS 140/7(1)(d)(iv). To the extent you consider this a denial, pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/9.5(a) you may file a Request for Review with the Public Access Counselor (PAC) at: Public Access Counselor; Office of the Attorney General; 500 South 2nd Street; Springfield, IL 62706.  You also have the right to seek judicial review of your denial by filing a lawsuit in the State circuit court; 5 ILCS 140/11. If you have any questions, please contact our office at (773) 553-3500. Thank you for your request. Sincerely, Annie Righi Freedom of Information Act Officer Chicago Public Schools

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: NIST / ANALYGENCE 2024 Contract
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

The contract between NIST and ANALYGENCE, awarding them a contract for helping with the National Vulnerability Database (NVD) backlog of enriching CVE IDs, and/or any support related to CVE ID analysis. Specifically, the amount of money dedicated to that specific task, the terms and conditions of said work, expected requirements, and any deadlines. A copy of the full contract with line-item expenditures is sufficient to fill this request.

Reference:
https://therecord.media/nist-nvd-backlog-contractor-analygence

I am an amateur journalist and will use these documents in part of my published work. I understand that there may be fees associated with this document retrieval and hereby agree to pay up to $100 for the retrieval and duplication of the requested documents. If the fee is in excess of $100, please contact me before beginning any work.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brian Martin

title: Records concerning the Space Force "Nail and Lipstick Color Guide"

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Records concerning the Space Force "Nail and Lipstick Color Guide"
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All briefs, emails, records, and any other documents on, about, mentioning, or concerning the creation of the Space Force "Nail and Lipstick Color Guide," which is included as Figure 4.2 of the "Space Force Guidance Memorandum Establishing U.S. Space Force (USSF) Dress and Appearance Standards," The source document can be found at https://static.e-publishing.af.mil/production/1/ussf/publication/spfgm2022-36-01/spfgm2022-36-01.pdf

I also request the same list of records about the development of rules 4.7 and 4.8 concerning fingernails and lipstick.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Ben Welsh

communications.subject: Request Acknowledgement - AF FOIA 2023-00530-F
communications.communication:
Dear Mr. Welsh, 
This is to acknowledge receipt of your 4 November 2022, Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request for "All briefs, emails, records, and any other documents on, about, mentioning, or concerning the creation of the Space Force "Nail and Lipstick Color Guide," which is included as Figure 4.2 of the "Space Force Guidance Memorandum Establishing U.S. Space Force (USSF) Dress and Appearance Standards."  You also sought a "list of records about the development of rules 4.7 and 4.8 concerning fingernails and lipstick." 
Our organization has a significant number of pending FOIA requests, which prevents us from making a response determination within 20 workdays and we have instituted multitrack processing of requests. 
We have assigned number 2023-00530-F to identify your request; should you need to contact us about your request.  Please direct your questions to Mr. Jonathan Staeblein at 703-692-9979 or SAF.AA.HAF.FOIA.Workflow@us.af.mil and use this assigned number to assist us in responding more promptly. 
Based on our current backlog, we expect to respond to your request not later than 90 days from the date of this email.  We will notify you in writing if additional processing time is required.  Our policy is to process requests within their respective tracks in the order in which we receive them. We process each FOIA request as quickly as we can. 
Very Respectfully, 
JONATHAN STAEBLEIN, GS-12, DAF 
SAF/AAII (FOIA) 
Office of the Secretary of the Air Force 
1000 Air Force Pentagon 
Washington, DC 20330-1000

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Request: Inslaw Inc. (FBI)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

This is a request under the Freedom of Information Act.  I hereby request the following records:

Files, records, memos and other materials relating to, mentioning or describing Inslaw, Inc. founded in Washington, D.C. in January 1981 by purchasing the assets, including specifically the PROMIS software copyright rights, from Institute for Law and Social Research, a non-profit, tax-exempt business that had begun operation in January 1973. Inslaw is best known for developing for the Department of Justice, and its now-defunct Law Enforcement Assistance Administration (LEAA) a computer program known as Prosecutor's Management Information System (Promis) and the subsequent Inslaw affair. I am specifically requesting any previously unreleased materials in addition to any previously released material.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Michael Best

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Request: Inslaw Inc. (FBI)
communications.communication:
Dear Mr. Best,

The FBI has received your Freedom of Information Act/Privacy (FOIPA) request and it will be forwarded to Initial Processing for review.   Your request will be processed under the provisions of FOIPA and a response will be mailed to you at a later date.

Requests for fee waivers and expedited processing will be addressed once your request has been assigned an FOIPA request number. You will receive written notification of the FBI's decision.

Information regarding the Freedom of Information Act/Privacy is available at http://www.fbi.gov<http://www.fbi.gov>/, http://www.fbi.gov/foia/ or http://www.justice.gov/oip.  If you require additional assistance please contact us at foipaquestions@ic.fbi.gov.

Thank you,



David P. Sobonya
Public Information Officer/GIS
Record/Information Dissemination Section (RIDS)
FBI-Records Management Division
170 Marcel Drive, Winchester, VA 22602-4843
PIO  (540) 868-4593
Direct  (540) 868-4286
Fax  (540) 868-4391/4997

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Request: Inslaw Inc. (FBI)

communications.subject: Pennsylvania Right to Know Act Request: Policy documents
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Pennsylvania Right to Know Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any policy manual, employee procedure manual, or folder of collected policies which guide police operations. This may be one document with many policies, or all policies collected.

The original format of the documents is acceptable (PDF, .doc, .txt, etc).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Josh Chamberlain

communications.subject: RE: Pennsylvania Right to Know Act Request: Policy documents
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

I wanted to follow up on the following Pennsylvania Right to Know Act request, copied below, and originally submitted on July 26, 2024. Please let me know when I can expect to receive a response.

Thanks for your help, and let me know if further clarification is needed.

communications.subject: Right to Know Request
communications.communication: Good afternoon.  Please see the attached response to your Right-to-Know Request from John P. Goodrich, Esq., Solicitor to the Allegheny County Sheriff's Office.

files.title: muckrock 24.08.09
files.source: Allegheny County Sheriff's Office, Allegheny County, PA

communications.subject: RE: Pennsylvania Right to Know Act Request: Policy documents
communications.communication:
Dear Mr. Goodrich,

I appreciate your reply. Rather than making an appeal, I will address your reasons for denial in order to clarify the request:

1. As you say, "Allegheny County Sheriff’s Office utilizes a large array of policies that guide its operations..." These are the policies which are being sought—those which guide police operations. For example, the Pittsburgh Bureau of Police publishes a "manual of procedural orders", which presumably does not contain information that would be excepted from disclosure under right-to-know law. https://pittsburghpa.gov/police/manual-procedural-orders

2. The intention of requesting records from the Allegheny County Sheriff's Office was to obtain records in custody the Allegheny County Sheriff's Office, and not from other agencies. I will be sure to adjust the language of future requests.

3. Certainly, I do not wish to endanger the Office's computer security or ongoing investigations. I believe the Office is well within its rights to redact or omit records which are excepted from disclosure. Please proceed with the request by supplying those policies which are not excepted.

Thank you,
Josh Chamberlain

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Socap
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records captioned "Socap", including 65-HQ-66114. This was described in a 1975 memo as a "Review of certain records to identify Soviet illegals who have applied for documentation as U.S. residents as part of their efforts to establish a bona fide cover identity." (https://www.archives.gov/files/research/jfk/releases/2018/docid-32989624.pdf)

Please conduct a search of the Central Records System, including but not limited to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, and the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices, for both main-file records and cross-reference records for all relevant names, individuals, agencies and companies. If any potentially responsive records have been destroyed and/or transferred to NARA, then I request copies of the destruction or transfer slips as well as any other documentation relating to, mentioning or describing said transfer or destruction, to include but not be limited to confirmation that the Bureau has no other copies of said records. If previously released records are available, then I request a rolling release consisting of those records while additional records are located and processed for release.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Paul Galante

** 

Please be advised that efoia@subscriptions.fbi.gov is a no-reply email
address. Questions regarding your FOIA request may be directed to
foipaquestions@fbi.gov. If you have received a FOIPA request number, please
include this in all correspondence concerning your request. Please note eFOIPA
requests are processed in the order that they are received. If you have not
received a FOIPA request number, your request is in the process of being
opened at which time it will be assigned a FOIPA request number and
correspondence will be forthcoming.

** 

Upon receipt of your FOIPA request number, you may check the status of your
FOIPA request on the FBI’s electronic FOIA Library (The Vault) on the FBI’s
public website, http://vault.fbi.gov by clicking on the ‘Check Status of Your
FOI/PA Request tool’ link. Status updates are performed on a weekly basis. If
you receive a comment that your FOIPA request number was not located in the
database, please check back at a later date.

communications.subject: RE: [EXTERNAL EMAIL] -  RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #1467465-000
communications.communication:
Good morning,

Thank you for contacting foipaquestions@fbi.gov.  Please check the status of your FOIPA Request at http://vault.fbi.gov by clicking on "Check Status of Your FOI/PA Request" on the right side of the page, and follow the instructions below.

Check the Status of Your FOIPA Request
If your FOIPA Number is [1234567-0] please enter [1234567-000] into the system. If your FOIPA Number is [1234567-1] please enter [1234567-001] into the system. If you have any questions about the status of your FOIPA request, please e-mail foipaquestions@fbi.gov.

FIND STATUS OF FOIPA- Request statuses are updated weekly

Please enter the whole FOIPA number-Example: [1234567-000]

FOIPA:
Results will show the Request Number, Case Type and Process Description shown below:
FOIPA:
1234567-000

Case Type:
FOIPA

Process Description (Will display the current progress of the request)
The FBI's FOIPA Program is searching the FBI's indices for potentially responsive documents.
You may be contacted via formal letter for all fees and/or negotiation issues that may apply.

NOTE: Recent requests are entered into the FOIPA database in the order that they are received. Before you can check the status, you must have received correspondence assigning a FOIPA request number and the information transferred to the online database. Status information is updated weekly. If a request has been closed within the last six months the online database will display the following: The FOIPA number entered has been closed, and appropriate correspondence has been sent to the address on file.

Estimated Dates of Completion
Requests are processed in the order in which they are received through our multi-track processing system.  Requests are divided into two primary tracks--simple (under 50 pages of potentially responsive documents) and complex (over 50 pages of potentially responsive documents).  Complex requests are further divided into medium, large, and extra-large sub-tracks based upon request size.  Simple track requests typically require the least amount of time to process.  Currently, simple track cases average approximately 104 days from the date of receipt for processing.  Our complex requests in the medium processing track are currently averaging 853 days, large processing track are currently averaging approximately 1,786 days, and extra-large processing track are currently averaging 2,500 days for processing.

Respectfully,

Public Information Officer
FBI - Information Management Division
200 Constitution Drive
Winchester, VA  22602
O: (540) 868-4593
E: foipaquestions@fbi.gov<mailto:foipaquestions@fbi.gov>

Do you have further questions about the FOI/PA process? Visit us at http://www.fbi.gov/foia

Please check the status of your request online at https://vault.fbi.gov/fdps-1/@@search-fdps    Status updates are performed on a weekly basis.

Note:  This is a non-emergency email address.  If this is an emergency, please call 911 directly.  If you need to report a tip for immediate action, please contact FBI Tips at http://tips.fbi.gov/ or reach out to your local field office.

title: Saint Paul Police Department, Saint Paul, MN Request

communications.subject: Minnesota Government Data Practices Act Request: Saint Paul Police Department, Saint Paul, MN Request
communications.communication:
To Whom it may concern,
Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:
Any and all records from the past year regarding your nuisance property ordinance that will be referred to as ordinance in this request but could be known (but not limited to) as Public Nuisance as described in Sec. 231.01 of the city code.
Please provide any and all written records (including but not limited to hard-copy documents, memos, emails, word processor documents, PDF documents, PowerPoint files, images files, video files etc.) regarding the Ordinance including but not limited to:
• police calls, reports, citations, or arrests, collected by the municipality police department for the purpose of enforcing the ordinance
The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.
In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.
Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request.
Sincerely,
Jenny Wadhwa

communications.subject: Police Department :: D078428-041024
communications.communication:
Dear Jenny: 
 
Thank you for your interest in public records of the City of Saint Paul. Your Minnesota Government Data Practices open records request has been received and is being processed. Your request was received in this office on 4/10/2024 and given the reference number D078428-041024 for tracking purposes. 
 
Record Requested: To Whom it may concern,
Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:
Any and all records from the past year regarding your nuisance property ordinance that will be referred to as ordinance in this request but could be known (but not limited to) as Public Nuisance as described in Sec. 231.01 of the city code.
Please provide any and all written records (including but not limited to hard-copy documents, memos, emails, word processor documents, PDF documents, PowerPoint files, images files, video files etc.) regarding the Ordinance including but not limited to:
• police calls, reports, citations, or arrests, collected by the municipality police department for the purpose of enforcing the ordinance
The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.
In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.
Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request.
Sincerely,
Jenny Wadhwa

City of Saint Paul

communications.subject: Police Statisitics :: D078450-041124
communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 
Thank you for your request.  Your request is being processed. Darlicia

communications.subject: Clarification
communications.communication:
Jenny Wadhwa,

I am sending this email in regard to the data request that you sent,  reference no. D078450-041124. Are you requesting data for nuisance properties or calls for public nuisance in regard to people? The ordinance you referenced is for an individual and not a property.  The other question I have is if you are looking for a specific area in the city? The last question is what data are you requesting; police reports? If you are looking for statistical data, the city has a website
https://information.stpaul.gov/ that could aid you in finding the information you are requesting.

Please let me know if you have any questions,

 [cid:image001.jpg@01DA9CA8.6E6C6FD0]
Michele Giampolo, PhD
Commander
Saint Paul Police Department
Technology Unit
367 Grove Street
Saint Paul, Minnesota 55101
(O) 651-266-5691 | (C) 651-359-6839
Email: michele.giampolo@ci.stpaul.mn.us<mailto:michele.giampolo@ci.stpaul.mn.us>
Please Take Our Survey
www.StPaul.gov/PoliceCommunitySurvey<http://www.stpaul.gov/PoliceCommunitySurvey%0d>

communications.subject: RE: Minnesota Government Data Practices Act Request #D078450-041124
communications.communication:
Hello,
We are looking for information regarding an individual, across the whole city. The data can be provided in the form of police reports or calls for service logs.

Thank you, 
Jenny

communications.subject: Clarification
communications.communication:
Good Morning,

We received your updated request and we need some clarification regarding your request. You stated you are looking for information regarding an individual across the whole city. Is there a specific individual? Are you looking for calls involving disorderly persons? Do you want just the statistical data on how many disorderly person's calls we have received in the past year? This may be easy to handle over a phone call if you would like to contact me via phone. My contact information is below.

Respectfully,

 [cid:image001.jpg@01DAA523.A1199E20]
Michele Giampolo, PhD
Commander
Saint Paul Police Department
Technology Unit
367 Grove Street
Saint Paul, Minnesota 55101
(O) 651-266-5691 | (C) 651-359-6839
Email: michele.giampolo@ci.stpaul.mn.us<mailto:michele.giampolo@ci.stpaul.mn.us>

www.StPaul.gov/PoliceCommunitySurvey<http://www.stpaul.gov/PoliceCommunitySurvey%0d>

communications.subject: RE: Minnesota Government Data Practices Act Request #D078450-041124
communications.communication:
Hello,
Apologies for the confusion. I would like calls involving disorderly persons and/or and statistical information regarding disorderly persons calls. I am currently on holiday abroad and am unable to call so please let me know if this information will suffice. 

Thank you,
Jenny Wadhwa

communications.subject: RE: Minnesota Government Data Practices Act Request #D078450-041124

communications.subject: Nevada Public Records Act Request: CJI 2024 final sales
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Nevada Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

- Settlement documents for the Craig Jones Invitational, held at the Thomas & Mack Center on August 16–17, 2024
- Final ticket sales broken out by seating level (platinum, gold, silver, etc)
- Final event cost as paid by the licensee
- Any contract amendments attached to the original booking contract

This is the event: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Craig_Jones_Invitational

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Chris Amico

communications.subject: JustFOIA: UNLV's NEW Public Records Request System RE: Nevada Public Records Act Request #PRR-2024-56
communications.communication:
Requestors of public information can submit a request (https://unlv.justfoia.com/publicportal) , track the status, and receive records online at https://unlv.justfoia.com/publicportal . 
The University of Nevada, Las Vegas is improving transparency by making public records easily accessible to the public. The Office of Public Affairs manages all public records (https://www.unlv.edu/publicrecords) submitted to the university. 
Kind regards, 

-- 
Public Affairs 
University of Nevada, Las Vegas publicrecords@unlv.edu (mailto:publicrecords@unlv.edu) 
Office: 702-895-3102 
unlv.edu (https://unlv.edu/) • Twitter Facebook Instagram YouTube Top 3 percent nationally in research activity. (https://www.unlv.edu/news/release/unlv-attains-highest-status-research-university)

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Communications Mayor Breed
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any and all communications between Mayor London Breed and the following persons:

Zach Rosen

Robin Pam

Todd David 

Eddie Kim

Joel Engardio

Myrna Melgar

Any and all communications to or from Mayor London Breed that mention Zach Rosen, Robin Pam, Todd David, Joel Engardio, Myrna Melgar, and Eddie Kim that mention The Great Highway, Friends of Great Highway Park, Great Highway Park, Gazetteer.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Belle Reve

communications.subject: Sunshine Great Highway
communications.communication:
Dear Belle Reve,

The Office of the Mayor received your attached request on August 20.  We are invoking a two week extension to further respond due to the need to consult with another City department.  Cal. Gov. Code 7922.535(a) and S.F. Admin. Code § 67.25(b).  We will further respond no later than September 13.  Please direct all correspondence about your request to this address.
Regards,

Hank Heckel
Legal Compliance Officer
Office of the Mayor
City and County of San Francisco

files.source: Office of the Mayor of San Francisco, San Francisco City and County, CA

communications.subject: RE: Sunshine Great Highway
communications.communication:
Dear Belle Reve,

Please see the attached responsive records to your referenced request.  Please note that the record entitled "Re_MEDIA Alert ..." has been redacted to protect personal contact information.  See California Constitution, Art. I, Sec. 1; Cal. Gov. Code 7927.700.  The record entitled "RE_Draft Great Highway ..." has been redacted pursuant to the attorney/client privilege.  See Cal. Gov't Code § 7927.705; Cal. Evid. Code § 954; S.F. Admin. Code § 67.21(k).

If you have any questions relating to your request, please let us know.
Regards,

Hank Heckel
Legal Compliance Officer
Office of the Mayor
City and County of San Francisco

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: CPS: Investigative Memos
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

Investigative Memorandum #9094
Investigative Memorandum #9095
Investigative Memorandum #9096
Investigative Memorandum #9097
Investigative Memorandum #9098
Investigative Memorandum #9099
Investigative Memorandum #9100
Investigative Memorandum #9101
Investigative Memorandum #9102
Investigative Memorandum #9103

Because this request is in the public interest for Illinois nonprofit The FOIA Bakery’s work to advocate for public education, please waive any fees in accordance with 5 ILCS § 140/6(c). Feel free to contact me with any questions, or if clarification is needed.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Miriam Bhimani

Chicago Public Schools (CPS) responds to all public records requests in accordance with the Illinois Freedom of Information Act (FOIA), 5 ILCS 140/1 et seq. 
Due to the volume and complexity of requests received in the normal course of business, CPS is extending the time for its initial response to your request by an additional 5 business days (to 10 business days total beginning on the first business day following receipt of the request) pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/3(e)(v) which allows for the examination and evaluation of the requested records by personnel to determine if they are exempt from disclosure under Section 7 of Illinois FOIA or should be revealed only with appropriate deletions. 
Upon the completion of a response, CPS will provide the first 50 pages to you at no charge.  If a response is more than 50 pages, a fee of 15¢ per page will be charged for each additional page. Copies of video recordings have a fee of $48. All applicable fees must be paid prior to the copying. CPS will inform you of any fees due if your paper response exceeds 50 pages. You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you’ll receive an email when your request has been completed. Thank you for using the CPS FOIA Center. 

Track the issue status and respond at: https://cps.mycusthelp.com/WEBAPP//_rs/RequestEdit.aspx?rid=15827

September 18, 2024 Miriam Bhimani Miriam.bhimani@gmail.com  RE: Chicago Public Schools FOIA Request N015827-071424 Dear Miriam Bhimani: This letter is in reply to your Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) Request seeking the following information: 
Supply the Investigative Memoranda with the following File Numbers: 
Investigative Memorandum #9096 Investigative Memorandum #9101 Investigative Memorandum #9103 RESPONSE: There are no responsive records as per your request as an investigation was not conducted. 
Investigative Memorandum #9094 RESPONSE: Documents responsive to your FOIA request are available to download via the Chicago Public Schools FOIA Center. Please visit the following link and enter your username and password to access the records: http://cps.edu/About_CPS/Departments/Law/Pages/FOIARequest.aspx . Under the rules of FOIA, private information and unique identifiers contained within public records are exempt from public disclosure; those portions have been redacted including private phone numbers, employee identification numbers, and other highly personal information. Pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/7 (1)(b), “Private information, unless disclosure is required by another provision of this Act, a State or federal law or a court order,” and pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/7(1)(c), “Personal information contained within public records, the disclosure of which would constitute a clearly unwarranted invasion of personal privacy, unless the disclosure is consented to in writing by the individual subjects of the information. “Unwarranted invasion of personal privacy” means the disclosure of information that is highly personal or objectionable to a reasonable person and in which the subject’s right to privacy outweighs the legitimate public interest in obtaining the information. The disclosure of information that bears on the public duties of public employees and officials shall not be considered an invasion of personal privacy. Lastly, records have been redacted pursuant to Section 7(1)(d)(iv) which allows a public to withhold records/information that would unavoidably reveal the identity of a complainant or witness. Investigative Memorandum #9095 RESPONSE: Documents responsive to your FOIA request are available to download via the Chicago Public Schools FOIA Center. Please visit the following link and enter your username and password to access the records: http://cps.edu/About_CPS/Departments/Law/Pages/FOIARequest.aspx . Under the rules of FOIA, private information and unique identifiers contained within public records are exempt from public disclosure; those portions have been redacted including, employee identification numbers, date of birth, and other highly personal information. Pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/7 (1)(b), “Private information, unless disclosure is required by another provision of this Act, a State or federal law or a court order,” and pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/7(1)(c), “Personal information contained within public records, the disclosure of which would constitute a clearly unwarranted invasion of personal privacy, unless the disclosure is consented to in writing by the individual subjects of the information. “Unwarranted invasion of personal privacy” means the disclosure of information that is highly personal or objectionable to a reasonable person and in which the subject’s right to privacy outweighs the legitimate public interest in obtaining the information. The disclosure of information that bears on the public duties of public employees and officials shall not be considered an invasion of personal privacy. Information has additionally been redacted pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/7(a): Information specifically prohibited by federal or State law or rules and regulations implementing federal or state law. Investigative Memorandum #9097 RESPONSE: Documents responsive to your FOIA request are available to download via the Chicago Public Schools FOIA Center. Please visit the following link and enter your username and password to access the records: http://cps.edu/About_CPS/Departments/Law/Pages/FOIARequest.aspx . Under the rules of FOIA, private information and unique identifiers contained within public records are exempt from public disclosure; those portions have been redacted including, employee identification numbers, date of birth, phone numbers, and other highly personal information. Pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/7 (1)(b), “Private information, unless disclosure is required by another provision of this Act, a State or federal law or a court order,” and pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/7(1)(c), “Personal information contained within public records, the disclosure of which would constitute a clearly unwarranted invasion of personal privacy, unless the disclosure is consented to in writing by the individual subjects of the information. “Unwarranted invasion of personal privacy” means the disclosure of information that is highly personal or objectionable to a reasonable person and in which the subject’s right to privacy outweighs the legitimate public interest in obtaining the information. The disclosure of information that bears on the public duties of public employees and officials shall not be considered an invasion of personal privacy. Information has additionally been redacted pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/7(a): Information specifically prohibited by federal or State law or rules and regulations implementing federal or state law. Portions of the information have been redacted to protect identifiable student information included within the records. Pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/7.5(r) in accordance with Illinois Student Records Act (ISSRA). ISSRA prohibits the disclosure of “school student records” and defines a “school student record” as “any writing or other recorded information concerning a student and by which a student may be individually identified, maintained by a school or at its direction or by an employee of a school, regardless of how or where the information is stored. 105 ILCS 10/(d): Release of a minor’s record may only be authorized by the parent or guardian in accordance with the Illinois Student Records Act (105 ILCS 10/1 et seq.). Investigative Memorandum #9098 RESPONSE: Documents responsive to your FOIA request are available to download via the Chicago Public Schools FOIA Center. Please visit the following link and enter your username and password to access the records: http://cps.edu/About_CPS/Departments/Law/Pages/FOIARequest.aspx . Under the rules of FOIA, private information and unique identifiers contained within public records are exempt from public disclosure; those portions have been redacted including, employee identification numbers, date of birth, phone numbers, private home address, and other highly personal information. Pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/7 (1)(b), “Private information, unless disclosure is required by another provision of this Act, a State or federal law or a court order,” and pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/7(1)(c), “Personal information contained within public records, the disclosure of which would constitute a clearly unwarranted invasion of personal privacy, unless the disclosure is consented to in writing by the individual subjects of the information. “Unwarranted invasion of personal privacy” means the disclosure of information that is highly personal or objectionable to a reasonable person and in which the subject’s right to privacy outweighs the legitimate public interest in obtaining the information. The disclosure of information that bears on the public duties of public employees and officials shall not be considered an invasion of personal privacy. Investigative Memorandum #9099 RESPONSE: Documents responsive to your FOIA request are available to download via the Chicago Public Schools FOIA Center. Please visit the following link and enter your username and password to access the records: http://cps.edu/About_CPS/Departments/Law/Pages/FOIARequest.aspx . Under the rules of FOIA, private information and unique identifiers contained within public records are exempt from public disclosure; those portions have been redacted including, private home address, private phone numbers, personal belongings information, and other highly personal information. Pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/7 (1)(b), “Private information, unless disclosure is required by another provision of this Act, a State or federal law or a court order,” and pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/7(1)(c), “Personal information contained within public records, the disclosure of which would constitute a clearly unwarranted invasion of personal privacy, unless the disclosure is consented to in writing by the individual subjects of the information. “Unwarranted invasion of personal privacy” means the disclosure of information that is highly personal or objectionable to a reasonable person and in which the subject’s right to privacy outweighs the legitimate public interest in obtaining the information. The disclosure of information that bears on the public duties of public employees and officials shall not be considered an invasion of personal privacy. Investigative Memorandum #9100 RESPONSE: Documents responsive to your FOIA request are available to download via the Chicago Public Schools FOIA Center. Please visit the following link and enter your username and password to access the records: http://cps.edu/About_CPS/Departments/Law/Pages/FOIARequest.aspx . Under the rules of FOIA, private information and unique identifiers contained within public records are exempt from public disclosure; those portions have been redacted including, employee identification number, private phone numbers, and other highly personal information. Pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/7 (1)(b), “Private information, unless disclosure is required by another provision of this Act, a State or federal law or a court order,” and pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/7(1)(c), “Personal information contained within public records, the disclosure of which would constitute a clearly unwarranted invasion of personal privacy, unless the disclosure is consented to in writing by the individual subjects of the information. “Unwarranted invasion of personal privacy” means the disclosure of information that is highly personal or objectionable to a reasonable person and in which the subject’s right to privacy outweighs the legitimate public interest in obtaining the information. The disclosure of information that bears on the public duties of public employees and officials shall not be considered an invasion of personal privacy. Records have been redacted pursuant to Section 7(1)(d)(iv) which allows a public to withhold records/information that would unavoidably reveal the identity of a complainant or witness. Redactions have been made pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/7(1)(a) which exempts from disclosure information specifically prohibited from disclosure by federal or State law or rules and regulations implementing federal or State law. Specifically, the Abused and Neglected Child Reporting Act, section 325 ILCS 5/1, states that all records concerning reports of child abuse and neglect or records concerning referrals under this Act and all records generated as a result of such reports or referrals, shall be confidential and shall not be disclosed except as specifically authorized by this Act or other applicable law. Redactions have been made pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/7(1)(a) corresponding with 105 ILCS 5/34-18.5(b) which prohibits the release of background check information. Furthermore, Illinois state law prohibits the release of portions of public employee personnel files, such as teacher performance evaluations. Per 105 ILCS 5/24A-7.1, “Disclosure of public school teacher, principal, and superintendent performance evaluations is prohibited,” and 820 ILCS 40/11, “Disclosure of performance evaluations under the Freedom of Information Act shall be prohibited,” and related documents have been removed. Investigative Memorandum #9102 RESPONSE: Documents responsive to your FOIA request are available to download via the Chicago Public Schools FOIA Center. Please visit the following link and enter your username and password to access the records: http://cps.edu/About_CPS/Departments/Law/Pages/FOIARequest.aspx . Under the rules of FOIA, private information and unique identifiers contained within public records are exempt from public disclosure; those portions have been redacted including, employee identification number, private phone numbers, private home address, and other highly personal information. Pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/7 (1)(b), “Private information, unless disclosure is required by another provision of this Act, a State or federal law or a court order,” and pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/7(1)(c), “Personal information contained within public records, the disclosure of which would constitute a clearly unwarranted invasion of personal privacy, unless the disclosure is consented to in writing by the individual subjects of the information. “Unwarranted invasion of personal privacy” means the disclosure of information that is highly personal or objectionable to a reasonable person and in which the subject’s right to privacy outweighs the legitimate public interest in obtaining the information. The disclosure of information that bears on the public duties of public employees and officials shall not be considered an invasion of personal privacy. Records have been redacted pursuant to Section 7(1)(d)(iv) which allows a public to withhold records/information that would unavoidably reveal the identity of a complainant or witness. Portions of the information have been redacted to protect identifiable student information included within the records. Pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/7.5(r) in accordance with Illinois Student Records Act (ISSRA). ISSRA prohibits the disclosure of “school student records” and defines a “school student record” as “any writing or other recorded information concerning a student and by which a student may be individually identified, maintained by a school or at its direction or by an employee of a school, regardless of how or where the information is stored. 105 ILCS 10/(d): Release of a minor’s record may only be authorized by the parent or guardian in accordance with the Illinois Student Records Act (105 ILCS 10/1 et seq.). In case of denial, pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/9.5(a) you may file a Request for Review with the Public Access Counselor (PAC) at: Public Access Counselor; Office of the Attorney General; 500 South 2nd Street; Springfield, IL 62706 . You also have the right to seek judicial review of your denial by filing a lawsuit in the State circuit court; 5 ILCS 140/11. If you have any questions, please contact our office at (773) 553-3500. Thank you for your request. Sincerely, Ana Diaz Freedom of Information Act Officer Chicago Public Schools

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Expedited FOIA Request NARA 22-V.A.MUCK. NARA FOIA Request and Appeals Case Processing Logs FY 22
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

(FYSA. FOIA Join the fight for FOIA compliance. FOIAcomplaince@gmail.com)

Expedited FOIA Request NARA 22-V.E.MUCK. NARA FOIA Request and Appeals Case Processing Logs FY 2022 . [See PDF for full FOIA Request]

I am respectfully seeking via Muckrock.com:

1.	NARA’s FY 2022 FOIA Operational Records FOIA Requests and Appeals FOIA Processing Logs. [NARA purports that it maintains separate FOIA units, one of which is "Operational Records," cited as a sub agency in FOIAonline.gov.]
a.	The FOIA Advisory Committee, approved Tech Committee Recommendation No. 2022-TS3 (Part 2) “Posting FOIA Logs” states:
 
“We recommend that agencies proactively publish FOIA logs in the agency’s electronic reading room (often referred to as FOIA Libraries) on an ongoing basis, at least quarterly. Agencies should allow for the full text searching of FOIA logs.
To be most useful, agency FOIA logs should contain, at a minimum, each of the following fields  in either Excel or CSV format, in preference to PDF:
a)	Tracking number of the request [or appeal].
b)	Date of the request [or appeal].
c)	Name of the requester, provided it is not a first-party requester (i.e., someone asking for records on himself or herself) – to be most useful, the agency should publish the names of all third-party requesters; the agency should also alert requesters that they will publish the names of third-party requesters in their FOIA logs.
d)	Organizational affiliation of the requester, if identified in the request [or appeal].
e)	Whether the request was processed under the Privacy Act as well.
f)	Subject matter of the request [or appeal]..
g)	Status of the request [or appeal] (pending, closed, etc.).
h)	For requests [or appeals].that have been closed, the date closed and the result of the FOIA request [or appeal] (granted, granted in part, denied, withdrawn, etc.).
i)	Fee Information
a.	Fee category assigned to requester, if applicable (commercial, educational, news media, other).
b.	Whether a fee waiver was requested.
c.	If a fee waiver was requested, whether it was granted.
d.	Amount of fees charged.
e.	Amount of fees paid.”


REQUESTED FORMAT. 

I am seeking all correspondence through MUCKROCK.com.

I am seeking a PDF file with thru MUCKROCK.com with: (1) a signed and dated cover letter (citing my personally assigned requester control number); (2) with record page count for all records released records (3) a copy of this request in your reply. I seek records in this format with an imbedded copy of my requests to (1) impede the agency from not addressing the FOIA Request; (2) impede the Agency from not providing the documents stated in the Agency’s letter reply, and (3) make it obvious in any subsequent review what the Agency has or has not done. 

Further, I request that these records be sent in any digital formats in which they exist (such as PDF and Excel). Under the terms of the E-FOIA Amendments of 1996, Section 5, if a document exists in electronic format, it must be released in that format upon request.

Each record must be provided as a distinct record in their native format. 
I am also seeking the “Description Available to the Public” field in FOIAonline be set to yes and that all records be released to and viewable in the application by the general Public. The release type must be set to “Unredacted – Releasable to the General Public: Will be available to the general public,” or to “Redacted – Releasable to the General Public: Will be available to the general public.”

This request is distinctly separate from any other. Please do not combine this request with any other request in your reply. I am requesting that each element of the records sought be specifically addressed in the reply.

EXPEDITED PROCESSING. 
I am seeking expedited processing. In any denial of my request for expedited processing the Agency must state in detail how my request does not meet requirement and who, by name, was involved in the denial determination.
1.	The  subject is of widespread and exceptional media interest and the information sought involves possible questions about the government's integrity that affect public confidence. 
a.	The next and final FOIA Advisory Committee of the 2020 – 2022 Term is June 9, 2022, where this matter will be discussed. This is the final term of this committee
b.	Based on records released regarding individualized tracking numbers, status and estimated completion dates of my FOIA requests and appeals, NARA may be engaging in massive false FOIA reporting. There can be no dispute  that such matters are the subject of widespread and exceptional media interest and the information sought involves possible questions about the government's integrity that affect public confidence.
c.	Please refer further to my FOIA Public Comments regarding the March 29, 2022 Senate Oversight Committee FOIA Hearings, wherein DOJ OIP and NARA’s OGIS were slammed for lack of FOIA compliance oversight. 
d.	I plan to distribute information from this expedited FOIA request to members of the media and others via a vast distribution network.
e.	I am an individual primarily engaged in dissemination of information via extensive email lists, blogs, coordination with Open Government Advocate Organizations and members of the media.

2.	Information is urgently needed to inform the public concerning some actual or alleged government activity/malfeasance. 
a.	See paragraph 1 above incorporated fully herein..
b.	I am recognized within to FOIA Advisory Committee Recommendation “OGIS 2.0: Reimagining FOIA Oversight” dated 05.04.2022 as an expert contributor “Robert (Bob) Hammond, Citizen FOIA Advocate.”
3.	In any denial of expedited processing, NARA must repeat each paragraph and sub-paragraph above and state explicitly how my request does not meet the cited standards. A blanket statement without doing so lacks required content.

In any denial of my request for expedited processing, I am seeking that the Agency identify who, by name and email was consulted and that the Agency provide specific justification  as to how my request stated herein does not qualify.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Robert Hammond

I am seeking a PDF file with thru MUCKROCK.com with: (1) a signed and dated cover letter (citing my personally assigned requester control number); (2) with record page count for all records released records (3) a copy of this request in your reply. I seek records in this format with an imbedded copy of my requests to (1) impede the agency from not addressing the FOIA Request; (2) impede the Agency from not providing the documents stated in the Agency’s letter reply, and (3) make it obvious in any subsequent review what the Agency has or has not done. 

Further, I request that these records be sent in any digital formats in which they exist (such as PDF and Excel). Under the terms of the E-FOIA Amendments of 1996, Section 5, if a document exists in electronic format, it must be released in that format upon request. 

Each record must be provided as a distinct record in their native format. 
I am also seeking the “Description Available to the Public” field in FOIAonline be set to yes and that all records be released to and viewable in the application by the general Public. The release type must be set to “Unredacted – Releasable to the General Public: Will be available to the general public,” or to “Redacted – Releasable to the General Public: Will be available to the general public.” 

This request is distinctly separate from any other. Please do not combine this request with any other request in your reply. I am requesting that each element of the records sought be specifically addressed in the reply. 

EXPEDITED PROCESSING. 
I am seeking expedited processing. In any denial of my request for expedited processing the Agency must state in detail how my request does not meet requirement and who, by name, was involved in the denial determination. 
1. The subject is of widespread and exceptional media interest and the information sought involves possible questions about the government's integrity that affect public confidence. 
a. The next and final FOIA Advisory Committee of the 2020 – 2022 Term is June 9, 2022, where this matter will be discussed. This is the final term of this committee 
b. Based on records released regarding individualized tracking numbers, status and estimated completion dates of my FOIA requests and appeals, NARA may be engaging in massive false FOIA reporting. There can be no dispute that such matters are the subject of widespread and exceptional media interest and the information sought involves possible questions about the government's integrity that affect public confidence. 
c. Please refer further to my FOIA Public Comments regarding the March 29, 2022 Senate Oversight Committee FOIA Hearings, wherein DOJ OIP and NARA’s OGIS were slammed for lack of FOIA compliance oversight. 
d. I plan to distribute information from this expedited FOIA request to members of the media and others via a vast distribution network. 
e. I am an individual primarily engaged in dissemination of information via extensive email lists, blogs, coordination with Open Government Advocate Organizations and members of the media. 

2. Information is urgently needed to inform the public concerning some actual or alleged government activity/malfeasance. 
a. See paragraph 1 above incorporated fully herein.. 
b. I am recognized within to FOIA Advisory Committee Recommendation “OGIS 2.0: Reimagining FOIA Oversight” dated 05.04.2022 as an expert contributor “Robert (Bob) Hammond, Citizen FOIA Advocate.” 
3. In any denial of expedited processing, NARA must repeat each paragraph and sub-paragraph above and state explicitly how my request does not meet the cited standards. A blanket statement without doing so lacks required content. 

In any denial of my request for expedited processing, I am seeking that the Agency identify who, by name and email was consulted and that the Agency provide specific justification as to how my request stated herein does not qualify. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires. 

Sincerely, 

Robert Hammond 

Attachments: 

https://cdn.muckrock.com/outbound_composer_attachments/perseverance2013/109300/NARA_22-V.D.MUCK._NARA_FOIA_Request_and_Appeals_Logs_FY_22.pdf 
Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fnational-archives-and-records-administration-129%252Fexpedited-foia-request-nara-22-vamuck-nara-foia-request-and-appeals-case-processing-logs-fy-22-129755%252F%253Femail%253Dadmin%252540foiaonline.gov&url_auth_token=AAAj2tdGHKX1-c-t6oDvxXcze3A%3A1ny6JM%3AJqyIxkt9Y6CPxP8sBVKZMGXJbTaOgLj-y-AaEORQmmc

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #NARA-NGC-2022-001272
communications.communication:
I am seeking immediate FOIA FPL dispute resolution regarding NARA's classification of this request as complex. Please advise Ms. Wall.

1. NARA’s FY 2022 FOIA Operational Records FOIA Requests and Appeals FOIA Processing Logs. [NARA purports that it maintains separate FOIA units, one of which is "Operational Records," cited as a sub agency in FOIAonline.gov.]
a. The FOIA Advisory Committee, approved Tech Committee Recommendation No. 2022-TS3 (Part 2) “Posting FOIA Logs” states:

“We recommend that agencies proactively publish FOIA logs in the agency’s electronic reading room (often referred to as FOIA Libraries) on an ongoing basis, at least quarterly. Agencies should allow for the full text searching of FOIA logs.
To be most useful, agency FOIA logs should contain, at a minimum, each of the following fields in either Excel or CSV format, in preference to PDF:
a) Tracking number of the request [or appeal].
b) Date of the request [or appeal].
c) Name of the requester, provided it is not a first-party requester (i.e., someone asking for records on himself or herself) – to be most useful, the agency should publish the names of all third-party requesters; the agency should also alert requesters that they will publish the names of third-party requesters in their FOIA logs.
d) Organizational affiliation of the requester, if identified in the request [or appeal].
e) Whether the request was processed under the Privacy Act as well.
f) Subject matter of the request [or appeal]..
g) Status of the request [or appeal] (pending, closed, etc.).
h) For requests [or appeals].that have been closed, the date closed and the result of the FOIA request [or appeal] (granted, granted in part, denied, withdrawn, etc.).
i) Fee Information
a. Fee category assigned to requester, if applicable (commercial, educational, news media, other).
b. Whether a fee waiver was requested.
c. If a fee waiver was requested, whether it was granted.
d. Amount of fees charged.
e. Amount of fees paid.”

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Documents, Sawmill Fire (U.S. Forest Service)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

According to recent media reports, the Sawmill Fire in Arizona is said to have been sparked by a gender-reveal party that involved the use of explosives on federal land. (https://tucson.com/news/local/watch-explosion-at-border-agent-s-gender-reveal-party-that/article_c67f4984-44cb-5536-9b9e-52403b26be6b.html#tracking-source=home-top-story)

Therefore, I am requesting the following records related to the evacuation of displaced persons from the Walmart parking lot on 2044 Forest Ave in Chico, CA:
- Any e-mails, text messages, or electronic communications between April 23, 2017 and November 27, 2018 that mention the Sawmill Fire.
- Any e-mails, text messages, or electronic communications between April 23, 2017 and November 27, 2018 that mention off-duty Border Patrol agent Dennis Dickey, and a gender reveal party involving Tannerite in the Green Valley, Arizona area. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. It will be used in the course of reporting for Motherboard, VICE’s science and technology website (www.motherboard.vice.com).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Caroline Haskins

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request: Documents, Sawmill Fire (U.S. Forest Service)
communications.communication:
Good morning Mrs. Haskins,

Prior to processing your request, could you re-look at the search parameters you have provided?  Region 3 includes New Mexico and Arizona, so while we can search for records related to the Sawmill Fire, we will not have records related to the Paradise Fire which occurred recently in CA.   For expediency, could you please let us know which offices you would like to have search for records?  Are you requesting that we have all the employees in Region 3 conduct an email search?  Limit the search to employees involved in the investigation and/or those who work in the Coronado National Forest that were affected by the fire?  Are you wanting records related to FS efforts in fighting the fire?  Are you interested in the records related to the numerous FOIA requests for the video?  The more specific you are in describing exactly which records you are interested in, and which offices you want to conduct the search, the faster and more accurately we will be able to provide the documents you are requesting.

The FOIA specifies two requirements for a request for records to be considered a valid, “perfected” request:  (1) It must “reasonably describe” the records requested and (2) it must be made in accordance with the agency’s published FOIA regulations.  After careful review of your FOIA request, the Forest Service has determined that your request does not specifically identify the records which you are seeking.  Records must be described in reasonably sufficient detail to enable government employees who are familiar with the subject area to locate records without placing an unreasonable burden upon the agency.  See 7 C.F.R. § 1.5(b), and Forest Service Handbook 6209.13.  Where possible, a requester should supply specific information regarding dates, titles, names of individuals, names of offices, and name of agencies or organizations that may help identify the records.  The FOIA does not require an agency to create new records, answer questions posed by requesters, or attempt to interpret a request that does not identify specific records.

In the event that we do not hear from you within 20 business days from the date of this email, we will assume you are no longer interested in this FOIA request, and the case will be administratively closed.  Please be advised that this action is not a denial of your request and will not preclude you from filing other requests in the future.

If you have any questions or concerns related to the processing you’re your request, please let me know.

Thank you,

Alisha

communications.subject: RE: [External Email]RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #2024-APHIS-03699-F
communications.communication:
Good morning Ms. Haskin,

A quick update on your request.


  1.  In your email below, you indicated that your request was submitted in November 2018, however according to our records, your request (2024-APHIS-03699-F) was dated and received in our office (USDA/APHIS) on January 31, 2024. This request seeks information on Neuralink.



  1.  Your 2018 email threads below indicate that you filed a request with U.S. Forest Service regarding documents related to the Sawmill Fire in Arizona sparked by a gender-reveal party involving use of explosives on federal land. U.S Forest Service is a different agency than USDA/APHIS therefore you will need to follow up with US Forest Service regarding documents related to the Sawmill Fire.



  1.  If the USDA/APHIS was involved with a federal response to the Sawmill Fire, it is not related to the current FOIA Request (2024-APHIS-03699-F).  Please follow up with the correct analyst who may have a related FOIA Request.



  1.  Lastly, your request (2024-APHIS-03699-F) was transferred to a new analyst, Shane Stonesifer. He can be contacted at shane.stonesifer@usda.gov<mailto:shane.stonesifer@usda.gov>. Going forward, please direct any future inquiries on this request to analyst Stonesifer.

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: FWS Technical Review Bellmar
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any and all records -- including email communications, memos, reimburseable agreements, white papers, power points slides, and other records — concerning the Fish and Wildlife Service's technical review of the permitting of the Bellmar project in southwest Florida. The project is a project of Collier Enterprises, and it is applying for a 404 permit form the state of Florida, per the Army Corpss delegation of 404 permitting authority to the state. The terms of that programmatic consultation that allowed the state of Florida to assume 404 authority required that FWS to conduct technical reviews and assistance to projects seeking 404 permits in order to ensure that they are in compliance with ESA Section 7. I wish to obtain records from FWS concerning its technical review and assistance as it relates to the Bellmar project. The Vero Beach office is likely the FWS office leading this review, along side FWS's Florida leadership team. Key FWS officials whose records to search for include Florida state leadership like Larry Williams and Robert Carey, as well as Jose Rivera at the Vero Beach Office.  

This request seeks records produced since January 1, 2023. 

I am a reporter for The Florida Center for Government Accountability and other outlets.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jimmy Tobias
